column4: hi people! after some updates and changes, when I restarted my ubuntu, the OS loader page options have duplicated! how to remove these duplicates?
you've probably installed a new kernel
try ubuntu tweak and clean it up

Thanks,I downloaded it. but I have another problem too! when I run update manager after getting my pass, this error occurred:The action would require the installation of packages from not authenticated sources.
even when i run The action would require the installation of packages from not authenticated sources...
I saw that:The action would require the installation of packages from not authenticated sources.
sorry:dpkg: requested operation requires superuser privilege
if you use ubuntu tweak too update your system you shouldn't really pay attention to that error
Now I am running tweak. how to clean up them?
and there you'll find a button "remove kernel"
but don't go berzerk :) remove the oldest one first
then reboot... and you should see one option less on the grub screen
there is 3 kernel packages: I think linux-image-2..-generic is installed by update manager recently.
now can I clean the first: linux-headers-2...-22 ?
